Human beings living in Northern Ireland suffered a pregnancy that would not survive. Rather than access the healthcare they needed on the NHS that they pay taxes to, they were forced to travel overseas. This is a heart-wrenching read but this is happening in the United Kingdom. https://t.co/isFACMPuJw

As I was just saying; perfect illustration of where we find ourselves. This is NOT a legitimate question, we have been brought to this place by racists who want to fight us on these terms. https://t.co/oc0ElFNW7d
RT @ameliagentleman: â€œHis role means he has oversight of all child sex abuse cases in England and Wales. â€œSo I know that the vast majorityâ€¦
Tldr; myth-busting Does. Not. Work.

This doesn't mean we lie as they do but it also doesn't mean we legitimise their victim narrative. We don't need to fight them on their terms. We create a new paradigm where hatred and lies has no space & no oxygen. We can create space outwith them and that doesn't reinforce them

The view that we need to engage with and defeat fascists in open debate disregards everything we now know about propaganda. Platforms and engagement hands fascists all the tools they need to win. We need to change and adapt.

We've been sucked into a university view of debating-society free speech dynamics when the rules of the debating society is an eliticist paradigm. You can't win human rights arguments when those whom abhor human rights are setting the rules.

Our free speech arguments are not fit for the age of misinformation and disinformation in an internet age. We seem unable to identify "elites" when the former Chief of Staff of the US President is defined as "anti-elite".

This shows the fundamental crisis we are facing; we're dancing to the alt-right tune on free speech.Our modern understanding of human rights was born out of the holocaust; a propaganda machine and many haven't learnt lessons. I think FM has got this right and our media hasn't. https://t.co/MTNCMOQX0G
@Kirsty_CSk Sign of the apocalypse afaik
